title: Ping spikes since server moved to chicago

embed.description: Test your mobile network speed, wherever you may be. Download the free Ookla Speedtest app for iOS, Amazon, Android or Windows Phone.

body: I used to have 20 ping every time i would ever play league of legends. I use Cable-One ISP and am in Northern Arizona. I have tried all of the methods i can imagine to fix my ping but to no avail. I am running win8 64bit, with a custom laptop with nvidia 980 graphics and an i7, clearly my pc is not the problem (plus i running much harder games via processing power with no problems what so ever. Now, i was wondering if i could be steered in the right direction to fix this problem. I know my ISP is not the problem as other games with servers based all over the board are running just fine never with more than 100 ping. In league of legends i sit at 67 ping at the very beginning, which then becomes random intermittent spikes (seemingly in the worst times possible) of 200-300 ping, and then after roughly the 20 minute mark of the game it may jump into the 700 ping range and even disconnect me from the server for about 1-2 minutes. As you can imagine this is unacceptable during a ranked match and hence i am here trying to work with you to fix this problem. Ill be waiting on your response

replies.body:
Changes in latency are typically caused by routing issues to the server along your ISP's infrastructure. Before we take a peek at your routing, be sure your local network settings are good to go by working through our [connection guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

Let me know if those steps helped.
i just followed all of your steps, and still isnt working. How do i attach files in here?

You aren't able to attach files here on the boards, but you can in a [support ticket.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) I recommend running some system logs with our [HRT App](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) before attaching them to your ticket.

Let me know if you have issues completing those steps.
